definition: to correct/to rectify/to redress/strong/brave/to pretend/to feign/affectation
Czech/Czech Republic/abbr. for 捷克[Jie2 ke4]

sentences.english: He is a lewd of a dandy, but admits skill, shrewd.
sentences.chinese: 他固然是個好色的紈絝子弟，但身手矯捷，精明能幹。

sentences.english: During the break, you can see her swift figure in the playground.
sentences.chinese: 休息時，你可以在操場上看見她矯捷的身影。

sentences.english: These requirements are considerably more flexible than those provided under (the law of the country of the Seller).
sentences.chinese: 那些要件要比賣方地點國的法令的規定矯捷很多。

sentences.english: Despite its agility, the cat faces particular dangers in today's modern cities.
sentences.chinese: 儘管身手矯捷，但貓在今天的現代城市中卻極其危險。

sentences.english: We will make arrangements for your courses according to your demand.
sentences.chinese: 按照您的要求矯捷放置課程上課時刻。

sentences.english: One way to reduce risk is to build flexibility into the operation.
sentences.chinese: 降低風險的一個體例是成立操作的矯捷性。
